They told us they would like guests have a better experience at the hotel if the circumstances permitted. Our kids had the best time as they had a diving pool and also baby pool not to mention a huge indoor play area. Will definitely be back again.

Pros: inexpensive, good location, good breakfast, great spa, nice pool, friendly staff Cons: pillows way too high, especially for kids, limited choice of food in hotel Other points: need to pay for airport transfers and limo rental in cash
really perfect and great
Location and facility was pretty good. Breakfast food was not bad either!!
We definitely enjoyed our stay in Caesar Park and we will come back for sure!!! Thank u for everything !!!
Good location and kind staff :) I would like to stay here next time again
Very good hotel especially for the family.
Good value for money. But the room is pretty old and due for renovation.
wow!! hotel was so goooood!! we had a good time here. It was so fun and happiest time of my trip to Taiwan.

Nice hotel, 10 min jokking to main street, shuttle bus station just at feet, but only 1 shuttle bus to Zuoying railway station at 11:30, cant catch the time to next trip. But will recommend to friends as well.

The Caesar Park Kenting is one of the most worn down hotels I have ever stayed at, and by no means a five star. Worn-down furniture that almost fell apart when sitting on them, stained sheets and super nasty room carpet, phone not working, shower had mold all over the silicon strings. Just nowhere near what I would call five star, probably equivalent of a Swedish 2-3 star... Would only recommend if you get a very good deal and then solely based on location and staff.

First the best news. The beach. It is gorgeous. It is close, and it is wonderful. Second, our room had an outdoor tub which I spent a lot of time in and a sweet little garden. However, for the price we paid for our room (over 300 USD a night) I was highly disappointed in the condition of both the room and the hotel. The place is really outdated, and fraying in many places. From getting to the pool an d sliding on a sliding bottom, to seeing the worn carpets and chairs, to the medicore food selections, I was not impressed one bit. One day we ordered lunch in the lobby. Three simple selections and it took 60 minutes for all of them to arrive at different times. So, basically, I say save your money, stay elswewhere, the beach is public. I do recommend a nice massage at the spa here though. That was worth every dollar!
Breakfast was great! everything is good! we simply love this place.

Good location, good amenities. Overall our favourite hotel the trip. kids enjoyed their indoor facilities when the weather was cold out there... Rooms were comfy. if only i have 3rd floor, view would be better. We will be back again if we visit Kenting again.
Good location, easily walk to main street; lots of on-site activities for kids
Went there with my boyfriend, the pool is lovely and we certainly enjoyed it a lot! The room is nice with the pool view\ Also, the location is amazing just a ten minutes walk to Kenting street
good breakfast, good choice for family with kids

This hotel looked like the best choice in Kenting. It's pretty, well designed and just in front of a beach. Looks luxurious but like they honestly say in their presentation, it's 20 years old so rooms need to be renovated... that is I guess what they are trying to do little by little. The buffet breakfast is very nice, a huge choice of asian and western food, with taiwanese style. We were upgraded and ended up in a jaccuzi poolside room which was very nice to try ! Cleaning needed to be improved tho (dust on upper shelves and birds poop on the terrace) but as we asked, it was quickly done. The beach is a bit creepy so I guess the hygiene standards in Kenting weren't what I expected. There are plenty of outdoor/indoor activities organized by the hotel, you can't get bored no matter what the weather is ! Very good surprises : the kids program and the big playground in the basement. Poor english is spoken in Kenting tho so not easy for foreigners to enjoy it all. So... not sure to go bk!
Unhappy order from Agoda Room bad and have Cockroach and Dirty IMG_5750.jpg IMG_5748.jpg IMG_5747.jpg IMG_5746.jpg IMG_5745.jpg
Close to sea beach, beautiful ocean view. Hotel is walking distance to the night market.

Really lovely hotel! Each room has a private outdoor space and ours was very clean. The grounds were so beautiful and the hotel has a semi-private beach. Small touches like free water and fruit in our room were nice. There's a free breakfast with a wide selection too. The hotel is at the end of the main drag where the night market takes place so location was great -- close but quiet. Would definitely recommend for friends, couples, or family traveling together!
Perfect location, rooms not as big as expected, really good breakfast, nice pool, just way too much mosquito, but overall happy stay.
Beautifully located near the Little Bay Beach , there was a good walking path to the beach. Nice facilities, great spa and we could rent bikes in the hotel and biked to Eluanbi.
This place was great for us. Quiet, good location, beautiful view from 3rd floor balcony mountain view. We’d love to come back.

the facility or the structure of the building looks old but the inside is known quite new as it was renovated. all staff members are very kind and willing to help and they are actually helpful. my friend and I failed to rent motor bikes and were looking for rides to the light house. we asked the staff and he got a solution :) we called a 10-seater van at TWD 800. we asked him very last minute but he tried his best:) thanks to him we could visit the light house. min
When i pushed one of the bed to join the other one i found a cockroach on the floor. When i called front desk it seems that it's a normal thing here... definitely not recommended.
It was uncomfortable to go from Kaohsiung airport to zuoying station, but I came here comfortably thanks to a free shuttle bus. The quarters are clean and the staff are kind.
酒店內設施非常多，適合兒童的活動亦多。行出洒店5分鐘便有很多小食店。職員年輕有活力，兒童一定不會感到悶。十分滿意。

We enjoyed our stay at Kenting. The hotel was nice. Floaties were provided for our use at the swimming pool. We could walk to the beach from the garden paths. The night market was only a short walk away. Buffet breakfast was good.

Great location, very near the town and restaurants.Comfortable room , full facilities, nice swimming pool and kids club.For sure we will return here next visit Kenting. Con: the room is quite old but exceptable.
A comfortable hotel, clean and good location.
Across the street from awesome beach. Great pool.

I hold a Hogm Kong passport and most of my friends did not need a visa to visit Taiwan but I had no idea that the Taiwanese Government Discriminate people who are born in China and realized the day of my flight that I needed to obtain a Visa( 5 days wait) because of the region I was born. I have notified agoda immediately to asking for just 50% of the total $900 USD of my 4 nights stay in which I was not able to flight to Taiwan due to visa issue. But i waited for 2 days for this 4 stars hotel to reject me. This hotel kept $900 from me knowing that I had a visa issue and could not travel to Taiwan that day or that week. I was not given any % of refund or any option to change the date and use my credit.. it was a total rip off . I will never consider this hotel even if I travel to Taiwan again the following month. Kindness and understanding is free and obviously this hotel don't care about their guests whatsoever. Book at your own risk travelers !
It was nice place and clean, well-organized Especially, the emerald sea and the white sand were so beautiful. Every hotel staff were very friendly.

All rooms has the same distance to the pool, and has the view of the pool and greens, we like the bathtub in our room, the whole room is decorated in a Bali island style. Staffs are nice and passion, showed great hospitality to my family and I. Buffet breakfast is delicious and has many kinds of food, including traditional Taiwanese food. The only thing to remember is to watch out for mosquitoes, close your window in the evening, because of the hot weather. The hotel has a big parking space, near the Kenting night market, you can rent a electric bike and go enjoy Taiwanese street food.
Good
Beach space is very nice.
It is a perfect place to bring kids there

The major reason we chose this hotel was because of the pool (for our 3yo daughter). It was under maintenance from the 2nd day of our stay. Very disappointing. The room itself was totally lovely, and we were able to spend time there relaxing. The breakfast was also great. The location is very convenient. The garden and grounds are beautiful and well maintained.

We’be been upgraded for free to a more spacious room. Staff was very helpful and made us find baby bathtub and baby bed in the room without we even asked for them. The play room and services for kids are great. The breakfast buffet was amazing.
fit for family and great for holiday pleasure~
Great hotel. It’s in front of the small clean beach. Hotel stuffs are at the beach too. I highly recommend this hotel.
The cafe food is really good.

Overall a good hotel. Cleanness could be improved as we found sand on the couch. A very kid-friendly hotel but the bed rail we requested was not installed properly (my daughter almost fell into the huge gap between the bed and the bed rail in the early morning!).

We booked 2 deluxe guest rooms for our party of 4 adults and 2 children for 2 nights. The rooms were big and beds were very comfortable. Except for one middled aged lady who manages the seat allocation at the buffet/restaurant, the rest of the staff were all very friendly and helpful. The hotel can get super crowded even during winter. We were there from 16-18/12 and there were many many guests. Location is superb and is just a short walk to Kenting Main Street. In fact, there is a pizza on van and other street hawkers just outside the hotel. Breakfast is good with a large vari
We felt relaxed, romanced and also quite at home too. No better place to stay.
back porch with sitting area and beautiful view.
Nice hotel and room, very convenience.
couldn't be a better place to stay in.

Interior of the hotel room is old. Chipped wooden furnitures within the room. Does not really feel or deserving to be a 5-star rated hotel. Hotel room is ULTRA far from the lift; easily a 3 - 5 min walk! Chinese restaurant within the hotel serves good food! Very proactive and helpful staffs. Provides free transport between Kaoshiung High Speed Rail & Hotel.
location O.K. No value for this 5/star hotel. Not recommend.
It is very close to Kenting Main Street and also near the beach. It has the necessary facilities as what we are expecting for a resort hotel. It is not too cheap in price though.

The hotel is lack of maintenance....both inside room and the swimming pool. The hotel is also full of large group of tour guests and they made the hotel common areas very noisy and congested which I don't like such kind of ambiance.
very friendly and efficient staff

Our second time to this lovely place, Kenting. We stayed in this hotel for two nights, convenient, great beach but a little bit old for the room decoration. Love the breakfast, lots of selection but the place is quite crowded. We liked the pool and the activities the hotel provided. This hotel would be a great choice for a family trip.
Close to sea beach, beautiful garden view. Hv balcony. Just small room.
Staff have limited English

I love the facility where their hotel is connected with the beach activity at the beach front. This hotel also has a walking path directly from hotel to the beach under the busy street which is safe. The path was decorated with nice scenery. The staff is professional courteous. It's location is another outstanding option for travelers. At night, we can walk out to the night market in 2 mins! We had such a great during our stay. I will highly recommend this hotel to all my friends who would like to travel to Kenting! I will definitely stay at this hotel again if I return. Special thanks to Joe/ director of operation who offered us his exceptional service.

Our second time to this lovely place, Kenting. We're family travelers with 2 adults and 2 kids, stayed in this hotel for two nights. It's convenient, great beach, nice staffs but the room deco is a bit old. Breakfast is great here with lots of selection but the place is quite crowded. The pool and activities provided is also great and we highly recommend it to family travelers.

Location - really close to the main street, 5 mins walk. Across the road there's a beach that you can rent sunbeds, sun umbrellas for free if you stay at this hotel. Room - spacious enough. comfy duvet, pillows were a bit too soft. Bed was wayyyy too bouncy. Bugs - cockroach alert. I found a HUDE dead one under my luggage & two baby ones in the bathroom. My brother in another room had a cockroach flying off his shirt when he tried to put the shirt on. Staff - super friendly & helpful. It was lashing when we came back and the kids heads were soaked. The staff automatically gave us some towels to wipe down the kids. defo 5 stars for this. Facilities - gym .. can't really call it that. It only had like 5 machines (thread mill & cycling bikes). A mini arcade - shooting basketball, drums, crisis [shooting game], some driving games, air hockey, a few mini games for kids. A row of teddy clamping machines but the clamps are ridiculously weak. don't waste money on this!!!. They had 5 or so table tennis tables which was great. Outdoor pool (didn't go see it since it rained while i was there). Overall i would only stay here if i go to kenting with Kids. Otherwise this place is just too expensive.

walkable distance to the night market. great facilities at the basement - ping pong, mahjong table etc. room is spacious and clean. staff polite and efficient. didnt go into the pool due to the weather. great stay overall.

We were travelling with two young children (both under 3 years old). The first bad feeling was that the staff assigned a room that's at the far end of the corridor, the room assigned was small compared to what we got for the past 5 visits. We had to spend 10 mins to walk to our room after swimming or dining. The staff at the restaurant at breakfast time was not serving happily. It seems that we were treated as the lowest priority of guests after they heard our room number. Very bad experience. We won't choose Kenting as our holiday destination in the near future.

I liked the location of the hotel. Although they don't have a private beach area, the beach across to the resort is secluded enough to make it feel like a private beach. The hardware in the rooms are bit dated but acceptable. They could offer a little bit more sitting areas at the beach during peak hours if possible.
We traveled with two kids and were enjoyed to stay there very much, will come back again for sure.

The resort is along the Kenting street so we can walk to the night market easily. There is a Pizza stall outside the resort which sells delicious pizza. The resort is also opposite the beach Xiaowan and the resort provides beach chair and toilet facilities for the guest. There are water sports at the beach (by private operator) which cost NTD400 for 3 water sports per person. The resort breakfast is nice too. There are facilities available at the resort recreation center. So on raining days, guest can stay in door and play Billard or table tennis games for free. Complimentary Shuttle bus service is provided to and fro from Zuoying High speed rail station at Kaohsiung. So guests can save on the transport cost if they stay at this resort.
My two kids are enjoyed to stay, great location and staff are friendly and helper. Will come back again.

This is not a 5 star hotel in any way. Pros: - great location - direct access to the beach - has a swimming pool Cons - dated facility. There were cracks on the wall, furniture were not in best shape. Our shower door doesn't close (by far!) so there's always a wet bathroom floor after shower. - not the cleanest. There were serious dust bunnies in our room. We booked the room with outdoor jacuzzi, maybe it's not used often!? There was a cockcroach. - staff not friendly. The hotel is extremely busy so maybe staff are overworked. But there were not friendly and when I made a request to switch table at breakfast the response was a huge sigh, silence, then "you can sit over there". Generally speaking, not smiley staff. - breakfast just ok. Big selection but most things ready made. I had hope for made-on-request egg station. - for the price I paid I had huge expectations, but I would say this is more like a 3.5 star hotel. They cater to huge crowds who came on tour buses.

At first glance everything looked great but into our two days' stay things started to deteriorate. The shower door doesn't fully close so the bathroom floor floods after every shower. There was also a leak from an unknown source outside the washroom by the carpet. Door stop fell out and we had to reinsert it. Central air vent smelled like it needed cleaning. It smelled quite moldy after our second day. Bed was spacious and comfortable. Looked very nice. Staff is the best part of this entire place. Everyone we met were extremely friendly and helpful. They have a sticker system where you can ask staff for their name stickers to stick on a sheet to commend or reprimand them.
Cozy room, nice gardening and excellent location.
everything is very nice, but restaurant no air condition.
Spa is professional and great.

The carpet in our room is very old and dirty. The stains are so easily to see that we couldn't walk in our room with barefoot. There are also some big cracks on the wall. The hallway smells horrible. I'd been dreamed to stay with Caesar Park Hotel before this trip, but it's really a huge disappointment for me and my friend.
This hotel is comfortable. There is a good view.

Apart from the pool and the beach （which unfortunately were not too usable in winter） there were not a lot of facilities for adults in the resort. The gym is a miniature one and did not arouse the enthusiasm to spend time in it. The best facility was the free shuttle to Kaohsiung HSR station, though it wasn't really publicised. We heard this only from the concierge when we booked a car for the day trip, and enquire how to get to Kaohsiung. To be fair, the staff were helpful, and the stay was enjoyable. One last thing.... we stayed in a modest room. The design was innovative but the lack of bedside tables really posed a serious problem....e.g. Where do you place your glasses and clock or watch?
Great location - close to all the actions and easy access to beach. Although the hotel was built years ago, the rooms have been recently fitted out nicely
Rm too old, toilet leaking, used tissue paper found on toilet floor upon checked in. Bed very small, no king sized bed just double bed. Lift too small as we r in a group of 8
Very good
Loved the location, the facilities, and the staff were super friendly! Rooms were great too.

2 out of 3 rooms have small cockroaches. After complaining to the staff, they still insist it it because it is the ground floor and because we have food in the room. Who don't have food in the room??? No place to hang wet towels. At least should provide some hanging place outside the room where the jacuzzi is to hang wet laundry. Bathroom also have no place to hang towels. Door of bathroom badly design as cannot lock and if someone suddenly push wrongly will have finger crush as i have experienced it. Even apple given has been eaten by someone, it had a bite in it. The breakfast restaurant staff was not very friendly as one of them mentioned seats can only reserved for 5 mins when there were a lot of empty seats on another side of the room. Very poor service. Some of the food in the restaurant also cold even under the warm lamp. I won't come back again to this hotel as the hotel staff also cannot understand why we need to stay near to each other since we book 3 rooms, 1 room must be separated from the other 2. Although it is within walking distance to beach but due to winter by 5pm it becomes quite dark. I have come with older parents that's why it is more relaxation. Even though it is such a high class hotel with Internet TV, but when using the mouse is such a pain in the ass. Why didn't provide a better mouse or keyboard? So unprofessional. At the end of the Kenting Street so have to walk from this end to the other.
Good!
Will visit next year and stay a longer period to enjoy the good weather and hotel facility.

Our room had recently been remodeled, but it had a bit of a funny smell and the shower wasn't as clean as we would have liked. However, the breakfast was plentiful and the pool was nice. We also appreciated the additional touches that place this hotel above its closest competition: free shuttle from the HSR, free beach chairs, and a easy walking distance to the night market and beach.

We reserved a jaccuzi garden room. The room was very clean and comfortable. The hotel is a luxury hotel. Has all the amenities of a luxury hotel. Staff was extremely polite and courteous. There was a cockroach in the shower, but cockroaches are everywhere in Taiwan. We called the front desk, and they sent someone very quickly. The manager also came to apologize for the cockroach being in the room and gave us a box of cookies. I was really impressed. They even mentioned to us that there is 24 hour service if we need anything at all any time.
Great breakfast and close to Kenting main street.
Nice staff
Would like to come again
Excellent location, rooms spacious and well equipped. Staff very helpful and courteous . Loved the hotel and location . A very pleasant and memorable experience. Would recommend this hotel .
Great room!
good

We like to go to this hotel while visiting Kenting but this time we were a bit disappointed. The hotel used to have a nice beach with white but currently this beach is full of rocks and almost no more white sand. The hotel facilities on the beach (toilets, shower) look terrible. I was told that the typhoon destroyed them but for this kind of hotel it is a shame to leave the facilities looking so bad. It should either be removed or fixed.
good
Highly recommended.
excellent location, helpful staff
Location is very good and price is affordable. Of course, slightly more expensive than town motels. But we like this one very much.
Good location, staff is very nice.

LOVED it. Terrific buffet dinner and breakfast. Enormous selection of well prepared food for every traveler's taste. Room excellent. Great pool. Staff were delightful and helpful. Too bad about a bit of typhoon damage but hope it'll get repaired, in time. The beach across the street is a mess. The hotel gardens look a bit frayed from the storms but the palms will grow new fronds and all will be prettier again. We will return!
This is a convenient hotel, very friendly to family travellers
good
The hotel faclities are not meet my expectation.
good
Great service. The room and pool are nice and clean. The location of this hotel is superb. It is close to the night market, beach and game centre. My son love it so much!
Good location
Good
Very nice resort. Friendly and helpful staff. Ample of activities for families and children.
good

Cons: Not up to international standards.Towels smelt of cigarettes, we were asked to give up deck chairs because "others had booked it!" Only had about 10 sun umbrellas on the beach for a hotel of 500 rooms. Pro: staff were friendly and helpful, free car parking, location close to night market, pool is pretty, children friendly.
Not recommended
excellent hotel
Great location and nice room. Breakfast is s bit hectic, but the food is fine.
The room is nice and spacious. Love the yard and pool. It is very pretty. Nice buffet breakfast with lots of variety. Staff are very friendly and helpful.
nice hotel
It was very nice to stay in Kenting!

This place is very family friendly as our little kid enjoyed her time in the free play area at B1. Walking distance to the little beach but make sure you don't go that way with any young kid after the sun is down.

Staff are kind. I didn't tell them that the day was my birthday, but they prepared a delicious cake for me. It's so sweet. The facilities are okay. My son fell down and got hurt near the pool, but the staff only gave me some medicine. However, the position is convenient.
Enjoyed, but the recreation could be improved better

The resort was pretty nice but some things were a little lacking. The resorts buffet was the same every morning and night and you're very lucky if you get most things hot. Especially eggs. Their shuttle to the airport runs once a day at 11:00. So if your flight is earlier than that than you have to pay to take the city bus. The city bus takes about 3 hours. The only other complain was that there wasn't enough chairs around the pool / enough shaded areas around the pool.
Great location with direct access pathway to beach . Beach is clean and nice .
Excellent
Very enjoyable hotel
the room is clean and big, hotel has a secrete beach, very beautiful.
The location is very good, near the main street of Kenting.
The hotel is clean and comfortable, location is nice and staff is friendly. Always enjoy to stay in this hotel, good place for young children

First, Some of Lobby staff need to improve their attitude. Not Hardworking smiling lobby lounge or shuttle Driver who helped me everysingle way, the CHECK IN STAFF. Whats wrong with them?! I know that hotel is not CONRAD, HILTON, LANGHAM, WYNN or many other hotels I've been stayed when I'm traveling, but THEY'RE RACK OF KINDNESS. AND ABOUT THE BEACH. I booked 4 peraon room, but they only let people use 1 parasols. I asked them for 2, so i get it, but still Dissapointment. AND about the door at the room. The sliding door MUST BE 20years old. SO STICK AND HARD TO OPEN. Overall, Not bad, and , maybe back there. BUT THEY NEED TO FIX THEMSELVES

Within walking distance we can access to the main street of Kenting, beach is just opposite to the hotel. Breakfast is good, services is good, staff are friendly. There are wide range of facilities and game in the playroom. We booked the garden jacuzzi room which is nice and we enjoyed it very much.
Will come back again!
overall good value
best choice
Just average performance of service.

Our small group had a wonderful stay. We especially liked the large, gorgeous tropical garden surrounding a beautiful swimming pool. The rooms were very comfortable, with one offering a jacuzzi and a small private garden. The buffet meals were all excellent with lots of international choices, although a bit noisy unless eating on the outdoor balcony. Just across the street is a small cove offering a beautiful and relaxing sandy beach with reclining chairs, umbrellas, towels; and calm swimming area. There is also a convenient and pleasant beach bar.

We enjoyed our one night stay in the hotel. Room was quite good, with balcony and a spa bath. A little dated, but nice. Beautiful little beach outside the resort too. Unfortunately the pool was being cleaned and refilled whilst we were there, which took away from our experience quite a bit, especially as it was a warm day. Quite expensive for the time of year and reckon there may be better options out there. Staff were excellent though.

My brother and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We liked the beach bar near the lovely cove and also the convenient towel and umbrella service. The beach is small, but very scenic, with nice sand and safe areas for swimming. The weather was great when we were there; but I hear at times the beach can be very windy with sand blowing all over. We also enjoyed the extensive international buffet and pleasant dining environment. The rooms were large and very comfortable. I would like to go back again.
The room is clean and tidy.the bed is comfortable.it is also easy to Go to beach and the receptionist is so nice
My stay was ok but the corridor between the rooms shows wear and tear which shouldn't happen in a five star hotel.

Very enjoyable stay with a really spacious room and Jacuzzi bath. Love the large pools and easy, garden access to the beach. Located at one end of kenting main street so it's both quiet yet convenient. I'd love to stay here again.
the bed is not comfortable
comfortable, nice bathroom and enjoyable pool

Very happy about out stay and will come back again. the only complains is there are not enough umbrellas to borrows. When we were there 4 days, almost everyday rained a little bit, and we always struggle with the hotel staff about the umbrellas borrow. Hotel management pays attentions here!!!! The hotel needs more umbrellas. you do not want your customer bring their own umbrellas because when they bring it back room, it wet the hallway, the room, everywhere gets wets.... Let them borrow it from the hotel so they return to the front door and your staff can take care of the wet umbrellas!!! So you hotel keeps dry during rainy days.
Raining all day. Hope Caesar Park could lower the dinning price so we could enjoy the food in the hotel, not outside the hotel.
overall is good. Hotel is old. Need some maintain, looks like a 4 stars hotel. Staffs are nice and helpful.
5 Star price, 3 star cleanliness and maintenance.
Sure will go again. Highly recommend for family.

In general, we had good experience in this resort. Location is very convenient to main night market street. BBQ buffet dinner was over priced !!! Food was so so but too costly when we paid separately Places for hanging clothes closet in room Was extremely small ! Some rooms are pre renovated ...Some rooms are newer and I wish we will be able to stay in the newly renovated rooms next time when we go to Kenting

the room was a bit small and not enough space for 4people. the door for bathroom was not fit completely so we need to change the room on the 1st floor paying extra 2500NTD for a night. the room was vlued about more than 500USD per night though it doesn;t make me feel being in the 5star hotel room. The only reason staying this hotel agian in the future is a great pool that provide various depth for children.
Except good location, nothing good worth mentioning. Poor food, especially BBQ. Poor service and attitude. Felt cheated by previous good comments.
Hotel room is a bit old and the garden is not as good as expect.Mainly the lighting design inside garden is not good.
Overall is a pleasant stay. Really enjoy the delicious breakfast but too many people, need to line up. The room is bit small and price a bit too high for that standard.
A nice and relax stay in Kenting
The hotel is located in the center of kenting. Walking distance to the night market. Good facilities for kids

Extremely nice. It might be a bit older but still for sure one of the best. The location next to the night market and city, but still quite and exclusive with the beach bay in front of it and the lush green garden with the pool in the back can't be beaten. Your right in the middle of everything but if your at the beach or at the pool you won't feel it. Staff is great, food is good (only the beach ball we thought was not good value for money). Enjoy it.

Disaponting. Service in lobby very slow and not attentative. Buffet was excellent. Service in Pearl River Restaurant sloppy. Crew at the reception incapable. They wanted to charge us twice for the room. The bill was mixed-up. After we informed them about the incorrect bill we received no feedback. The so-called Superior Double Room was just about good enough for one person. The room was so small that there was no place to store the luggage.
good location in Kenting. Room is large enough for 2 people to stay
good,but my time of stay is too short.
Quite good, but the furniture is a bit old and the staff are not professional enough.

1. Bus from KaoShun to Kenting on 1st Apr- I was check-in by 1st Apr and the shuttle bus are terriable when departure from KaoShun HSR station to Kenting, there are 2 shuttle bus and we take the first one, the bus are very dirty and a lot of mosquito are flying inside of bus. 2. Chair on beach- one room only allow to rent 2 chair on the beach, we have reserved one room with 4 person but still get 2 chair on the beach. why hotel have such stupid rule?
Very pleasant. Will definitely come back
We are very satisfied with staying here. My children were so happy in the kid's playground, swimming pool, beach... Fantastic hotel.
Great hotel location near the Kenting main street night market. The staff is friendly and professional. Nice & clean hotel room!
BAD AND HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE WITH FRONT DESK. NOT STAY AGAIN.
Perfect

In overall, it is a great hotel. Location, facility, cleanliness are 5 star rated. However, we were so upset with the response from a staff on the game/pool section. If we ignored the poor service from certain staffs, it was a great stay experience...

We booked a quad room. Overall is very nice and near to their main shopping street. However the room comes with a open toilet concept. They do have panels to between the toilet and the room but the gap between the panel is so wide that anyone can see the toilet. No privacy at all in that sense.
satisfactory, but no reading or make up table in the room

Stay was good, but compared to many other places in Asia, I still feel that Caesar Park is overpriced. Everything was good, but DEFINITELY didn't like the fact that they kept Blue and Yellow Macaw on the premise for entertainment use. These are endangered birds from South America that are restricted from international trade. Please stop using them for entertainment.
Good service, good location and best hotel in Kent

U can take a easy walk to the beach without crossing the road, just a short walk to night market but the breakfast is too crowded where I have to wait in a long queue. The breakfast buffet is not exciting also. Most staff are nice but the receptionist needs to be trained better, it seems that I'm being looked down as I book through agoda and half way through my checkin, she talked in the phone and another staff finished the process after I have waited 20 mins.

I booked the room the night before we check in. We stay at the other hotel the first night. Only pay for $119 from agoda mobile app. The hotel check us in to an ocean view room. The breakfast was lot better than expected. The breakfast area has a balcony looking out to the ocean. Lots of selections of western and Taiwanese food. Love the coffee making machine, you can make latte, espresso etc. Very happy with the service from the staff also. Staff were very friendly and professional. Compare to the other newer one with modern design hotel we stayed the first night, my husband and I both like this one better. This hotel has minimal design but attention to detail. (for example, the very quiet toilet flush and strong flush). Overall with no complain at all and will definitely stay here again for our next visit.

Very helpful staff who helped us with booking our tour activities. Really appreciate the free shuttle service, however there's only one timing available each direction. Feels great to have complementary cold canned drinks that are replenished every day. The massage at angsana span was also splendid. Buffet dinner with wide selections.
Broken glass on floor in the room and lots of confusion at breakfast The hotel is not a 5 star hotel I would rate this hotel at a 3

I stayed at Casear for 3 nights in August 2014, to celebrate my son's birthday. I arranged with the hotel in advance so they prepared a birthday cake (for free). The location is not bad, you can easily walk down to the main street. The hotel room is not as nice as I expected as my friend told me this is one of the most beautiful hotel in Kenting. Anyway, I booked an ocean view room, but is kind of half ocean view (half blocked with tall trees). The shower room is ...I didn't expect to have such a old style rustty shower room(inside the shower room, there were unremoverable stink) The bath tub is good, so is kinda look odd with a nice room but a rusty shower room. Overall the hotel is not bad, the food (breakfast and dinner buffet) is ok, definitely not the best. I had lunch and dinner at their lobby lounge, food was good except there were flies. I am heading to Kenting again in Easter 2015, and will try other hotel.....

I stayed at Casear for 3 nights in August 2014, to celebrate my son's birthday. I arranged with the hotel in advance so they prepared a birthday cake (for free). The location is not bad, you can easily walk down to the main street. The hotel room is not as nice as I expected as my friend told me this is one of the most beautiful hotel in Kenting. Anyway, I booked an ocean view room, but is kind of half ocean view (half blocked with tall trees). The shower room is ...I didn't expect to have such a old style rustty shower room(inside the shower room, there were unremoverable stink) The bath tub is good, so is kinda look odd with a nice room but a rusty shower room. Overall the hotel is not bad, the food (breakfast and dinner buffet) is ok, definitely not the best. I had lunch and dinner at their lobby lounge, food was good except there were flies. I am heading to Kenting again in Easter 2015, and will try other hotel.....
Great hotel stay.. but need to walk around 5mins to night market
hospitality to be enhanced, esp.the receptionist; and room service could be prolonged till late

I was requested to pay for my child (TWD500 per night)so that she can get a bathroom set (eg. towel, robe, tooth brush,tooth paste) during check in but only received the bathroom set after calling the reception to inform them that it was not delivered Other than above incident, I am quite satisfied with the hotel. It may not be brand new but the standard of cleanliness and comfort is acceptable.
it's like a dream come true. will stay here next time, definitely.
This is the 3rd time i've been kenting, none of the service and hotel can compare with Caesar as it has picking guests service, nice breakfast and facilities.
very good trip
While Caesar park hotel Kenting maybe be little bit old, but it is one of the best resort in Kenting. The staff were friendly, the location was not too far off from the main street or the beach.

Relaxing stay at the hotel. We booked three rooms, one of my friends commented that the hotel staff knocked on her door to inform her that the food & beverages in the room are free. Dinner and breakfast are good,although breakfast selection could be better.
The receptionist was really nice & helpful when we requested for early check-in after a long drive from Kaohshiung. The rooms given were clean and the snacks & beverages are all free. =)
Very busy and over crowded, staff often make you feel you're just one if far to many,
My bed and the bathroom are dirty. Others facility are good
Very nice and relax

The hotel would have to imrpove how their staff communicating with customers. The hardware is good but the service is not up to the standard. Staff tend to push customers away when they are busy, which is not good for hotel.
It was a fantastic stay at this hotel. Great added value services especially sightseeing tours and close to Kenting Street. Well maintained beach and hotel.
great stay, friendly staff, nice surroundings
The hotel is great, but the TV lack HDMI. When we mentioned this to the staff they moved us into another room. The staff are very good and helpful.

First time stay at this hotel, though some facilities could do with an upgrade, the hotel has a good resort ambiance with nice swimming pool and separate arcade/playroom for kids. Location at the end of Kenting Main Street. Also handy to have bus stop located in front of the hotel. Hotel staff are very friendly and efficient. We had left our watches in the hotel room and the housekeeping staff were able to find them and send them back to us in Hong Kong. Big thumbs up!

This was a very good hotel to relax in. Nice grounds and pool and good local beach. The hotel had its own area on the beach with loungers and shades -excellent. Only negative point was the WiFi which was off air and slow at times.
Very good experience about the location, room quality and the price/performance. Will consider next time
Relax and Comfortable
very very dirty

The hotel is good for family holiday with swimming pool and kids in mind for many facilities. Only down side is too crowd in breakfast buffet during morning session may be due to full house. Anyway a top choice of hotel for family or romance couple staying at Kenting. The room with pool and garden is bit pricy with value for money.

Good. The halls near our room often had a strong smell of cigarette smoke. Some of that residue often went into our room. Did not like those sliding doors that surround the bathroom. Our room was a family room. It was big enough for 4 people. We were disappointed that we had to pay for one breakfast every morning we were there.
Love this hotel for the cleanliness and the spacious room. comes with a balcony. just opposite the hotel across a small road is the beach and they have a nice bistro bar there.

I first see the hotel room, I surprised. It seems to me that I returned my home. In front of the room, there was small garden on my own. In the garden a bathtub, many trees. I can hear birds song. Warm weather, blue sky, It's a paradise.
Good location in Kenting, next to beach and shuttle bus stop station, very beautiful design, smiling face everywhere, cleaning room, and good food.

I called ahead to mention I was bringing my 4 month son and 20 month daughter. I asked if they could provide a crib for my room. When we arrived, there was not only a crib but a baby tub and potty along with little slippers for my daughter. Plenty of things for kids to see and do. My daughter loved the macaws that they put in the lobby in the morning. One complaint was the eggs, bacon, and sausage were a little cold at breakfast but the buffet has a ton of stuff to choose from.

We had an amazing time at Caesar Park Hotel. Kenting was beautiful....we were right on the beach, the pool was great too....quiet and fun. down the road was a little town to hang out in. we went just to relax and enjoy each other and it was perfect for that!

Helpful staffs and big hotels. Pity that it is too cold to enjoy the seemingly wonderful swimming pools and hotel beach. Everything is generally fine, but with some minor drawbacks as follows. No gynasium. Arm-chairs and coffee table in room block the way to the balcony and the wardrobe, which cause inconvenience in using the room facilities. Although big bath tub is provided, the shower area is too small, and insufficient space to put my personal cleansing bottles. The photos of the room in Agoda seems to have presented the most attractive features, but hided the the above drawbacks.
Very nice stay at Caesar Park hotel. The staff was friendly and food was of good quality.
The hotel is nice and clean and a private Jacuzzi in the room is so enjoyable. We will definitely come back again

The hotel was nice, staffs were friendly. However, as we went in winter, Kenting, despite is not too cold in winter, it is not a place for winter sports. So, there isn't really much to do in Kenting, despite the nice place. In addition, the transportation from the airport to the hotel is not convenient, in the sense that there is only one bus per hour, and despite the published schedule, it is not always on time.

I was really disappointed with this hotel especially as it had so many good reviews. The bathroom had dust on the door frames and soap scum all around the shower doors. The WiFi was painfully slow. The jacuzzi area was tackily decorated with gnomes and Snow White figurines, not what you expect from a five star villa. The worse thing is there was at least a 2inch gap at the room door which let's a lot of noise in. Housekeeping starts vacuuming the hallway at 8:45am so if you are planning on sleeping whilst on a relaxing holiday, don't count on it. I tried explaining this to the hotel and all I got was 'thank you, good bye'.

Good resort, specially for families. Nice location in Kenting, near the night market and Taiwan Tour bus stop. The breakfast was super, the dinner buffet was good, although lacked seafood, staff was attentive. The room we had was great, with its own jacuzzi.

This is the best hotel to be stayed at Kenting. Although the room is a bit old-fashion in style, it has excellent service. The staff will try to provide all the helps u need with excellent manner. The hotel facilities are good and they even got a dehumidifer in each room and has a self-service laundry which is something important for me. The game room is huge with lots of different activities which suit both kids and audlts.

The hotel is situated right next to a bustling night market. The hotel itself was great! The staff were excellent, great service and helpful. The breakfast was amazing and the pool and beach areas worked very well. I would definitely stay at this hotel again when I am back to Kenting!

Very good, except in one area of hotel, the A/C noice is very large. We have to switch the room in the mid night to avoid such noise. The hotel stuff are very nice to help us to switch the room, which we are very appreciate. Do hope hotel could improve on removing the noice of A/C equipment in that area.
Would highly recommend it, definitely a True 5 Star hotel, extremely comfortable.

At $122.00 per night it was a great deal. Taiwan is usually cheaper but in this resort town you will pay for "fine accommodations" and compared to other 5* hotels this was a good deal on agoda. the regular price of $225.00 would be too much.

We had one of those fabulous jacuzzi rooms for five days - what a way to unwind. The hotel is a few hundred meters out of town - which makes it quiet but still in easy walking distance to the restaurants and bars in Kenting. It has its own beach with a great beach bar in the evenings. There are a lot of families with kids, which makes breakfast quite lively - maybe a tad to lively for some.

We had a wonderful visit. The hotel and staff were wonderful. The hotel is situated very centrally so that you can enjoy the natural wonders of Kenting and return to relative luxury in the evening. The breakfast buffet was a winner and perfect for families with a diversity of tastes.

If you get a bus to Kenting it stops at the door. Beautiful hotel and gardens with several restraunts. The chinese was good but I had one of the worst hamburgers I have ever had - thick minced grisle - chips were good - in the lounge area. My other gripe is that I was travelling with my wife but we only got one breakfast voucher. I had booked a room with breakfast included but my docket for some reason said only one breakfast. Maybe my fault or not clear on the agoda form. We were in 4 hotels (others not booked through agoda) on the trip and this was the only one that wouldn't serve us breakfast without paying extra. Overall though it was a great place and has schuttle busses to Kaohsiung Air port and high speed railway station, very handy on our return trip(nearly 2 hours away). There are a couple of pretty birds that hang around the piano bar in the morning - Macaws are larger that you think. The doorway to the balcony is in the middle of a glass wall and is cluttered with a table and chairs, don't try to take the direct route back into the room as you brain yourself on the very clean and invisible glass.
Was awesome ,near the night market ,easy for eating food and near the beach
A hotel which I will return and recommend ! Wide variety of food at breakfast and caters to vegetarian. Staff are friendly and efficient.
Very nice! It is worthy of the money. Sure will consider to use this hotel again.
it's one of the largest resort hotel in Kenting. Location is good, walking distance to beach and shopping area. Room is ok, as 4-5 stars standard should be better.
good for family travel. however, during peak season, the pools are too small for such a crowded group. restuarant food is just soso.

The experience in Caeser was great! The hotel has rich resources of activities and all the staffs are very helpful for advice and help. I like to sit near the swimming pool and enjoy the reading time. Or go for a fabulous SPA.
Caesar Park Hotel Kenting is close to the beach, very good kid activities centre, inexpensive buffet dinner, very relaxing environment for family time.
good swimming pool, but no sauna, very sad about that. very near to the town.
Great hotel although it is a little pricey. Private path to beach
We will come back again next year to enjoy nice beach, swimming pool, food and complete relax time.
Satisfying. The staff and children coaches are warm and welcoming. Only draw-back is too many families and children - I guess every parents think the same

Professionalism of hotel staff is particularly commendable. My husband and our 2 year-old toddler were stung by a jellyfish on the beach and got immediate attention from the hotel lifeguard and beach staff. Saline was at hand to wash away the stings and local advice readily provided on how to address the situation. A hotel car was promptly arranged, at no additional charge, to take us to the nearest hospital at Heng Chun and its driver patiently waited to return us yo the hotel after consultation. This was greatly appreciated.

Hotel price is on the higher end for the range in Kenting. A 5 star but be prepared for the crowd as it seemed the place is packed with family with children. Morning breakfast was filled with parents with children. Not a place for romantic getaway but maybe family gathering. Breakfast buffet was localized with smaller range of intercontinental spread. Location is good as it is just located at the end of the main street where the night turns into a bustling nite market with hordes of tourists flowing in both directions like a synchronized rally walk. The hotwl does not have a private beach but in-house pool for guest to relax
I enjoyed my stay and this is my 3rd visit to this hotel. I love the breakfast; use to play table tennis and then take a swim. Staff is warm and friendly.

OK I guess. Only stayed for 2 days, rained on both days and I was sick (fever) for one day, so my impression is baised to say the least. For one thig, food doesnot not taste good when one is sick and you are in no mood for any activities. The only thing I enjoyed were the nice bed and pillows and the spacious bathroom. But, annoyingly, internet was very slow, maybe due to the large number of users. .

We chose the hotel because of its location and the fact that they had rooms for 3 people. The hotel is situated right next to the most active town in the Kenting area, which has a bustling night market and lot of restaurants. It was nice to be able to enjoy both the calmness of the hotel and the liveliness of the town. The hotel itself was superb also! We received very kind service, the breakfast was amazing and the pool and beach areas worked very well. All-in-all I would definitely recommend the hotel!

I expected more from a 5 star, high price resort hotel. Instead, I was disappointed. The hotel lobby is huge and glamorous, but was also packed with family and group travelers. The hotel has only 1 café and restaurant, but the public children’s pool might be great for those with children who want to swim in the pool. The room has a nice bathroom and tub, and managed to just squeeze in 2 big beds in a medium sized room. But the décor is not well maintained, with some wallpaper and panel peeling off the wall, which is very disappointing for me. The breakfast is famous enough to attract both hotel guests and outside tourists, which makes the breakfast time a jam packed carnival. The breakfast has good variety, especially on the pastry, but overall is just above average to my taste. This hotel is right across the main street from the beach, with about 10min walk to the local attraction scene where there are much more good cheap food stands and shops.
The room was clean, but we couldn't see the ocean from the 2nd floor.Near the hotel there are 2 stall pizzeria, we took it out and ate in the room.
Something they may improve is the carpark, as well as the activities for kids.

it was our fifth stay at this hotel. we really like the pool area and the access to the beach. this time we had a poolside villa to the left of the lobby. it seems that they have problems with the humidity which you can see on several spots in the room. but otherwise it was once more a great stay at this hotel with its beautiful surrounding.

We booked a jacuzzi room and loved it. The hotel is truly a five star with world class service and amenities. The room includes complimentary daily fruits (apple, orange, banana, and kiwi) along with complimentary daily drinks (two bottles of water, small can of sprite, iced oolong tea, vegetable fruit drink and sport drink). The bathroom includes your standard amenities plus shaving kit, toothbrush kit and foldable hairbrush. It was nice to have a portable dehumidifier as it quickly dried our wet beach clothes. Without it, our clothes would have taken days to dry in the humid weather. The beach across the street Xiaowan (little beach) was well maintained by the Caesar Park Hotel and the hotel provides complimentary lounge chairs with beach umbrellas for the hotel guests. In our opinion, Xiaowan was a much nicer beach than Baixia (White Sand Beach) as there was no litter or trash on Xiaowan. The hotel pool looked really nice and inviting, but we never had a chance to use it with such a nice beach across the street. Everything in Kenting is relatively close and easy to get to. We heard there may be a free shuttle bus from Kaohsiung Airport to the Caesar Park Hotel, but we ended up taking the Pingtung Express bus which as a stop right at the hotel. The buffet breakfast had a wide variety which changes daily, but it not worth the $550NT per person when much better and cheaper options (less than $100NT) are available in the nearby town of Heng Chun.

The location of the hotel is superb. Hotel car park had long queue but I went to check-in while my husband waited for parking so it's acceptable. I forgot to choose 2 adults and 1 kid when I booked the hotel so we have got breakfast for one adult only. The hotel room was better than expected. Our room is very spacious with 2 queen-size beds and a huge bathroom (one big bath tub and one shower area). My 2-yr-old son loved the room so much and he played around happily. We enjoyed the morning landscape of Kenting so much on the balcony. The Kenting main street is just 2 mins walk so you could find restaurants and shops very easily. The beach is just at the opposite with 2 mins walk but remember to borrow the towels in the hotel first as there is no towels available at the beach. The breakfast area is big and there're many different cuisine for you to choose from. But as it's a popular hotel the restaurant was too crowded for me so I recommend you to go there earlier.

We stayed there for 3 days and 2 nights. It was a really lovely stay. We were fully satisfied with everything except for the beach bar, as there wasn't any live music just like what the website said. The breakfast didn't meet our expectation as I heard somewhere else before our departure that the food was amazing, but it turned out to be average. Overall, it's a recommended place to stay, though. We had a really great time in Kenting mainly because of the great facilities that the hotel offered.
room and service are pretty good , need only 5 mins walk to the night market .
Close to main street. Good services and facilities
Loved the atmosphere, loved the people, loved food, overall loved everything there. Great staff and great customer service.
The overall services s fair not up to Internatinal standard. There was no introduction on facilities and environment upon check in.
Unfortunately, we had no web access in our room. The wifi did not work as requested, even after we reported it, it has not been repaired. Even hair on the bed could be found from the cleaning lady.
a very nice environment, the staff provide a professional serives and really helpful, it's a really good place for relaxation and holiday

I stayed in Caesar this first time in Kenting with my wife. But we booked a family deluxe. The hotel should have been renovated recently. The room is big. The beds are large. The room has two double bed. Should be for a family of 4. Beds are comfortable. Service is good and polited. Breakfast is ok. Location of the hotel is excellent. Just at the end of the Main Street of Kenting. You can just walk to the hottest spot of Kenting. But the hotel is better for family, especially when staying with kids, not for couples

a comfortable and romantic hotel for single travelers. the hotel offer shuttle bus to gaoxiong, cheap trip to travel around with a handsome guide, a beautiful swimming pool and private beach, and beach bar with live music. nice plae to relax and enjoy kending.

Overall it was a pleasant one night stay with the family. Parking was readily available, service was efficient, rooms were clean and quite a good range of amenities were complimentary. The kids enjoyed going back and forth from the beach to the pool. In the evening, the huge recreational area for kids was great for the kids and kept them entertained! As a regular visitor to Kenting, I would definitely go back to Cesar again.

The hotel is modern and spacious. Staff are friendly and the location is very good for a walk to the beach and also close, but not too close, to the restaurants and small bars in the local Kenting town. Room has an open plan bathroom with a big bath so very comfotable to relax in the bath and watch TV or do whatever comes naturally.

The room doesn't even have a desk, so you have to put the laptop on the bed. The pool is very small. The food in the restaurant is good, though there are not as many vegetarian dishes I would like. The hotel is located at a quiet area and it's about 800m from the main street in Kenting.

We had two rooms with four adults. When we first arrived they didn't want to give us all breakfast, instead they only wanted one person to get a breakfast for each room, instead of two people for each room. I had called the hotel about a month earlier to confirm that both couples got breakfast, and they said, "No problem" but they must of forgot. After a lot of confusion and a bit of anger they called us later and gave us the breakfasts.

i think that the veiw ands service are good, but the beach which near the resort is not pretty n clean enough. i can see a lot of stone and rubbish on the beach. thus, i just went once. the resort is near the night market and you can buy food and things easily.
room is too old. there is just nothing to say more. no good
room is too old. there is just nothing to say more. no good

the stay was pretty nice but i think the hotel is a tad expensive for what it is. there were also a couple of times where the rules of the hotel didn't make much sense. we went to the beach one day but they claimed we could only use two sunbeds despite my party staying in a family room (4 people. i had to argue the point until they eventually gave in but told us if too many people arrive on the beach we had to give two sun beds back. hardly 5 star customer service.

if you are looking for a resort hotel with international service level in Kenting, Caesar Park Kenting Hotel shall be one of your good choice. There's a beach just in front of the beach and just 5 min walk to the main street, or you can just stay in the hotel to enjoy the resort facilities.

i would recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking to enjoy their stay in kenting. reason being that the staffs are highly appreciated by my wife and myself. our boy was sick and went to hospital during our last day in kaohsiung and we are suppose to head to kenting. while we reached, the hotel staffs have already been notified by me that our boy is not feeling well. during the first night stay, our boy's temperature was raise to nearly 39c and we immediately asked for the help from the front desk and it was already 1030pm. being stayed in hengchun and kenting for 3 years way back 20years ago. knowing the condition of the hospital is very limited but the staff who drove us to hospital has gone through 3 hospitals before we have help at the 4th hospital. when we were back to hotel and in the room, the hotel staff pay special attention to us the next morning making sure our boy is well. we thank the driver who brought us around in the night and making his way out to help us. thank you and we will certainly come back again soon after the typhoon. cheeers,

Our two-year old daughter loved it. Particularly the swimming pool that she never wanted to leave. Also much appreciated was the ample activity rooms, necessary for entertainment during tropical storms. The small but wonderful beach was just a walk away across a busy but easily crossable road. The bustling lively town with it's night market style stalls was in very easy reach. The restaurants in town were very tourist orientated. Consequently, I would suggest paying full board, which we, to our regret, didn't do but definitely will do when we return: the food was excellent. We enjoyed the room, in spite of limited space for clothes, etc. The view of the sea was splendid.
Walking distance from the busy Night market street but still away from the noise. The room is comfortable. Nice beach right in the front. Good service. A little too popular in peak season though.

We 'met' a severe typhoon during our stay. We read from the news that it was quite chaotic outside as there was severe flooding in the area. However, hotel staff was able to manage the situation quite well even on the day when some of the staff could not come to work. We stayed in a jacuzzi villa which we enjoyed very much. Having a door to have direct access to the pool adds to the convenience. There is a jumping board in the pool and the boys loved it. Overall we are satisfied with the stay. And I would like to say thank you very much to the staff. They have provided very good service. The hotel is a bit pricey though.

We had a Family Deluxe Room, which had two Queen Size beds, separate shower and bathtub. The mattresses and bed sheets were of high quality and comfortable. The view (sea view) was beautiful. The buffet breakfast (included) was wonderful, with lots of varieties. Location is great, as it's not on but close to Kenting Main Street (about 5 minutes walk), and so it's quiet but convenient. Staff was very friendly. Swimming pool was not big but nicely set up with a diving board. The only drawback was that the so-called beach (on the other side of the road) was public and crowded with not only visitors but peoples selling water activities. I'll not go to that beach again.

Good location, close to Kenting street. the location also close to bus stop from Kaoshiun. Big swimming pool, and there are activities for the young kids arranged by hotel free of charge. The kids were happy to join. Hotel close to all shopping and dining shops in walking distance. Just the beach is too crowed.
Rooms clean and comfortably. peoples very nice A lot of free activities for kids

It's just like typical american resorts in the U.S., with not so good service compared to other TW Hotels. Pros are it's private beach opposite to it's resort and it's Bali island style swimming pool.
Overall hotel is good but the room is too small for 4 ppl stay. The daily event arrangement is good for kids. However, the price is really high and I don't think it really worth that money.
Even though it's a bit expensive but you will have a wonderful service. I'm pretty sure that I will use this hotel again if i have a chance to visit Kenting again
Nice environment and with facilities and good service. Despite being stuck at time of typhoon, the creation centre helped kill half day comfortably.

5 star hotel but a bit old. at first time front desk at first gave me a room without bath tub ay the very end of corridor . it is not what we see on website . we need to go down again to ask for re-checking our booking . finally the room is correct. since it was typhoon approachng the beach closed but my kid went too kid's room to spend the afternoon. it is also near main street about 8 min walk . we had a great stay there o

We stayed in the hotel 2 nights. Initially, we were concerned about some feedbacks that the hotel was old and dated. When we arrived, we were surprised it did not look that old at all, and was in fact very well maintained, and combined Asian with Garden styles in their layout and furnishings. I believe the hotel has been refurnished, as the lobby, rooms and surroundings are relatively new. The hotel staff were very warm and friendful, and very helpful in giving advice for our trip. The hotel also has a complimentary shuttle every alternate days to bring guests to the nearby Hengchun domestic airport. The room was very spacious. We took a deluxe family room, and it came with 2 double beds, and even have a private garden with jacuzzi?! We were pleasantly surprised at getting such good amenities for the price we paid. The beds were comfortable, and the toiletries were of good quality. An interesting feature of this hotel is that it kept two pet parrots, and they made special stand in the lobby cafeteria, so that guests could interact with the birds. And when not in the cafeteria, the brids have a special house in the gardens of the hotel. As we had took train from Hualien to Fang Liao (nearest stop to go Kenting), we had to book a cab (TWD 900, one way) to bring us to Kenting. It was around 50 mins drive. On hindsight, it'd be more time saving to take a flight from Taipei to Kenting (only 1.15hr and cost TWD 1,800 one way) - we didnt know about this when we went. However, we took the Uni Air one way flight back to Taipei to save on travelling time, so we could have time to shop. For sightseeing, the taxi driver offered to give us a private tour of Kenting's attractions st TWD400 an hour, but we did not take it up. Instead, we found very good value in Caesar Park's tour desk in the lobby. We signed up for the half day tour to some costal sights like Feng Chiu Sa, Elaunbi Lighthouse. There were only 5 guests for the whole tour, and they used a 30

I do think this hotel is really good for the family because the location is perfect moreover the provide free shower for the guest who go'in to swim in their privte beach.When check-out and you can spend time at the basement for games.

the hotel is nice with a nice breakfast and dinner buffet. the beach might be a bit crowded but it is o.k. the pool side though is very nicly set up. the staff is very friendly but speak hardly english. the bathroom and the room are nice.

There was a wonderful breakfast with so many options to choose from. Very close to one of the beaches and right on Kenting Street. We could rent scooters right from the hotel and it was very easy to do. The hotel offered a free bus to and from the Kaohsiung HSR station. The outside Jacuzzi area was pretty and private.
Want pleasantly surprised with the new room upgrade, thought that it would be a overcrowded hotel with high noise levels
Traveled with my friend around Taiwan and our stay in Kenting was the best stop during our vacation. Beautiful room, clean and nice. The best pillows ever!
within walking distance to the main street, very convenient yet not too annoyed by the busy street crowd. however, compare to twin bedroom, double bedroom is a bit small.
we did enjoy the time in Caesar Park Kenting hotel, no matter what facilities, attendant, service...etc. all are the best in Taiwan!

it is on end of kenting ave. the walk to the semi-private beach is very pleasant. overall the services are good. we took a 2.5 hours tour by the hotel to the south tip of islands with multiple scenical point on the way, pretty good. room is nicely done. we spent more time on jacuzzi than we previously planned. as the weather is bit chilly and windy, we didn't go to the pool.

my friend and i stayed there for one night and the overall experience was good. we received a free upgrade and the rooms were quite nice, although not very big. i did not have a chance to eat at their restaurants, but i did purchase something from their bakery, and that was good. they also gladly gave us a late check out. what bothered me about this trip was not the hotel itself, but the way the staff handled a certain situation. they had mistakenly given us two breakfast coupons upon checking in, but in fact our package only included breakfast for one. a few hours after checking in they called our room telling us that we had to either return the extra breakfast coupon or pay another 800+10%. i did not mind returning it since i don't like to eat breakfast. what bothered me was the way they handled their mistake, making it sound casual. this is a five star hotel, and it's normal to have higher expectations. no apologies were heard from them concerning their mistake. i felt the need to fill out their guest comment card, and after checking out i received a call from their manager, apologizing for causing such inconvenience.
Needs to Offer 2 different schedule for transportation

we are family of 4 and stayed there for 5 nights during easter and there is nothing 5 star about this hotel. there is a silly rule that guest has to wear a swimming hat to swim in the pool, including children. never experienced that in any other hotel. staffs are... umum.. i can't say they are bad but you don't feel welcome and they are not friendly, they will answer your questions but nothing more. staffs at concierge and reception are like robot, i asked about the national aquarium in the area and all he wanted to is to arrange a car and charge an inflated price. i asked for a brochure and he said not available but i turned around and saw the brochure right there on the shelf in 2 different languages. when you waalk through the glass doors in the lobby, there is sewage smell which i found unacceptable. we smelled that the whole period of stay, awful ! overall, it was a okay stay but with the the price we paid it's not good value at all and we will never stay there again.

room was spacious, clean and bright, yet quiet. jacuzzi was a little small. reception staff were helpful but lacked a smiley and warm face at times, but were generally nice. the angsana spa was probably the best part of the hotel.

We stayed during New Year holidays so the weather was quite cool and we had not many days to swim (there is a path which goes from the hotel straight to the beach under the road). However the hotel is located quite conveniently for travelling aroung by car. The service was OK, staff very friendly and helpful, I highly recommend Jacuzzi Villas as it was very relaxing in the evenings. The area around is very scenic and interesting to explore.

the room is well designed with enough space for 4 persons to live together. everything was prepared in 4 persons' portion although we did have only 2 persons. the bedding was comfortable. there were many people to have breakfast at the same time. it's a relaxing place. however, it is not near kenting main street & requires for about 7 to 10 mins walk.

very nice and modern hotel in southern Taiwan. however they don't have their own beach and beach service is not that good. I laid down on the beach 4pm and tried to sleep. but all the staff come again and again telling me the service will close 5pm, which realy bothers me cannot go into sleep.

Not all staff was fluent in English, but everybody had very positive attitude and was very helpful It is at same standard as similar level hotels in Phuket, a bit in need or renovation, but surprisingly good destination. Price was also very reasonable.
When we ask for transformer of electricity, we are told it's not enough. Also when we say our safe box is broken, they didn't come to fix it

the service is good especially if you travel with kids. There are many courses for different age group from 5yr+ old. sometimes you can just put them in and you can have little time to relax. THe price is reasonable. Room is clean and toilet is big.

The Caesar park is an attractive hotel set in beautiful grounds. The exterior of the buildings looks a little dated, but the interior is nice. The rooms are large, and pleasantly finished. Beds are comfortable, the service is good, and the buffet breakfast offers a huge selection of good food. The hotel is across the street from the beach, but provides private access via a pretty walk through the grounds, and a tunnel under the road.

We're a family of 4 (with 2 children) and hence we focused on hotels providing family rooms. We choose a Jacuzzi "Villa" at Caesar Park. The "Villa" is the G/F unit of the 3/storeys hotel. It includes a private garden with a Jacuzzi and 2 king-size beds.The room is in a modern Japanese style. Doors of the bathroom can be opened at all front overlooking the sleeping area, and can be closed as well for privacy. The focus is of course the nicely decorated garden with a jacuzzi - which undoubtedly enhanced the whole experience. Those "villa" next to the swimming pool has a separate and independent entry via the garden. Others (like ours) have to enter along the corridor of the hotel. It's within walking distance to the Kenting Main Street but keep a reasonable distance from it as well to avoid the noise. Breakfast is reasonably good (but I won't say it's excellence). It's a bit surprised that there is no gym in a resort hotel!

Our family have thoroughly enjoyed the stay at this hotel. Everyone enjoyed soaking up in the deep tub after long day of activities, especially post heavy eating & shopping at nearby 垦丁大街. Simply slide open the doors of the open concept bathroom, one can enjoy a movie or room service. The fittings within the shower cubicle were great too.... It really massages away the day's stress. The huge breakfast selection satisfy both adults & kids. Only pity is lack of beach front....otherwise would be a perfect resort.

I have stayed in this hotel twice and both times I chose the Jacuzzi villa which is great if you want to sit naked in your spa in your own private courtyard and garden. Almost Banyan Tree resort type of feeling. The hotel upkeep could be better but I think by the so-so standards of Taiwan, this hotel is quite good. The breakfast spread is also good with proper eggs and bacon and none of the soup kitchen atmosphere you get in a lot of local run Taiwanese hotels. I would return to this hotel again if I visit Kenting.
staff is willing to help customer to order hotels in kaohsiung and taipei, especially in the peak season. eg. christmas days and new year periods

the location is very good as it's just at the end of kenting main street. service was great as they did try their best to help us on whatever we needed (like dinner booking, car renting.. etc) they also offered free shuttle from and to kaohsiung. breakfast was nice too and the jacuzzi room was very comfortable! my other 2 pairs of friends liked this hotel very much too and we had a really enjoyable and memorable time there!!

This is one of my favorite hotels. I had stayed here once before about 20 years ago. Since then the price has been so expensive it was too far out of our budget. Thanks to Agoda we were able to do it again and loved it!

it was quite an enjoyable stay. hotel was conveniently located. went on one of their day tours and it was pretty good as the group size was small, 6 of us (including three of us). hotel staff were generally okay but some staff service wasnt so good. the chinese restaurant serves pretty good chinese food but when we asked for sugar for chrysanthemum tea, they wanted to charge us for the rock sugar. (which shouldnt be the case for a five star hotel) in the first plce, we didnt ask for rock sugar but the lady manager said we had to pay for the sugar which didnt make sense.

Spent 3nights with two younger kids. They loved the hotel. Near to night market and sea. Nice environment. Great variety of buffet breakfast. Staffs are very friendly and always greeted with a truthful smile. Wide varieties of newspaper to choose from too. Will definately go back when i go kenting again. Great memories.

Really great series of attractively landscaped inter-locking pools and plenty of space in the rooms, tho the lay-out of ours a little odd -- long and narrow in parts, so sometimes hard for two people to pass each other to get to the door for example. Also, the decor in some places is perhaps getting a bit frayed, (fabrics frayed and stained, paint peeling, etc) and a tiny point, but I missed not having the magnified mirror in the bathroom that many hotels offer and which helps so much for those with less than perfect eyesight when putting on make-up and shaving. The products offered -- lotions, bath gel and so on seemed very high quality, but the notice advising you that "amenities" offered were not to be removed from the hotel was a little off-putting -- and it was unclear if it referred to the robes and slippers for example where it seems entirely reasonable that they are for the duration of your stay only, or if the hotel truly meant that the little bottles of shampoo, lotions and so on, were for use in the hotel only. Finally, we have to say a word about the food. The Chinese restaurant, which we tried once, was fine, but did not compare, as we had been advised would often be the case in Taiwan, with very simple restaurants that we found - and loved -- in Kenting Town. And the room service which we ordered on the day it rained and we decided to eat on our terrace was very poor quality and expensive. The room service so-called Taiwanese seafood soup to be particularly avoided!
We have a wonderful 2 days stay at the hotel. Staff are friendly and greeted us with smiles. Great room and breakfast as well.

We have booked a family delux room and they upgraded us to those with private jacuzzi and a nice little garden. We really enjoyed the jaccuzzi and had a great time in the room. The pool is nice and good for adults in view of the depth. Dining choices are limited but we just enjoyed the meals in the kenting main street. Friendly staff.

The room was very spacious! Perfect for non- couples as there were two double beds. Staff are xtremely helpful and friendly and spoke English well. There is a beach opposite the hotel that has loungers and umbrellas and even beach toys for kids (especially for hotel guests). There is also a beach bar and fun water sports. The hotel is so close to the Kenting night market, maybe a 5 minute walk. A great choice!!!!

it was our third time at the the hotel. first time came there in 1990(!!!), then again in 1999 and now. though there are much more hotels now, we still like this well-established hotel and it is nice to return. it is great that the the beach is open again and the hotels beach facility is nice. relatively quiet and romantic at night.
